Header.Name: fusionChartType
Header.Tooltip: Fusion Charts Type

Header.Name: fusionCdaPath
Header.Tooltip: CDA Path

Header.Name: chartLink
Header.Tooltip: Fusion Chart Link

Header.Name: categoriesParam
Header.Tooltip: Fusion Chart categoriesParam name

Header.Name: seriesParam
Header.Tooltip: Fusion Chart seriesParam name

Header.Name: valueParam
Header.Tooltip: Fusion Chart valueParam name

Header.Name: realTimeChartTypeLine
Header.Tooltip: Real Time Charts Type

Header.Name: realTimeChartTypeColumn
Header.Tooltip: Real Time Charts Type

Header.Name: canvasBgColor
Header.Tooltip: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.

Header.Name: canvasBorderThickness
Header.Tooltip: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.

Header.Name: bgColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute

Header.Name: showBorder
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?

Header.Name: borderColor
Header.Tooltip: Border color of the chart.

Header.Name: caption
Header.Tooltip: Caption of the chart.

Header.Name: subCaption
Header.Tooltip: Sub-caption of the chart.

Header.Name: xAxisName
Header.Tooltip: X-Axis Title of the Chart.

Header.Name: yAxisName
Header.Tooltip: Y-Axis Title of the chart.

Header.Name: refreshInterval
Header.Tooltip: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data

Header.Name: clearChartInterval
Header.Tooltip: The time after which the chart will keep clearing its contents.

Header.Name: numDisplaySets
Header.Description: Max number of data points to plot
Header.Tooltip: This value helps you specify the number of data items that you want as history on the chart. For example, when you set it as 50, only 50 data items (per dataset) will be displayed on the chart. As soon as the 51st data comes in, the first data will be deleted and the rest of the data will be shifted by 1 position left - the new data will come and take the last position.

Header.Name: showYAxisValues
Header.Tooltip: The y-axis of charts is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not

Header.Name: yAxisValueDecimals
Header.Tooltip: Decimal places for y-axis values.

Header.Name: showLabels
Header.Tooltip: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.

Header.Name: labelDisplay
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you can control how your data labels (x-axis labels) will appear on the chart. There are 4 options: WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. WRAP wraps the label text if it's longer than the allotted area. ROTATE rotates the label in vertical or slanted position. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.

Header.Name: slantLabels
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.

Header.Name: labelStep
Header.Tooltip: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attributes just lets you do so. It allows you to display every n(th) X-axis label.

Header.Name: showValues
Header.Tooltip: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.

Header.Name: placeValuesInside
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show data values, you can show them inside the columns using this attribute. By default, the data values show outside the column.

Header.Name: rotateValues
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.

Header.Name: showLegend
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show legend for the chart (only multi-series and combination charts)?

Header.Name: legendPosition
Header.Tooltip: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below the chart (BOTTOM) and on the RIGHT side of the chart.

Header.Name: formatNumber
Header.Tooltip: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 ifformatNumber='0'.

Header.Name: numberPrefix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000.

Header.Name: numberSuffix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. For more details, please seeAdvanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: decimals
Header.Tooltip: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: formatNumberScale
Header.Tooltip: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end

Header.Name: baseFont
Header.Tooltip: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify outCnvBaseFont attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.

Header.Name: baseFontSize
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

Header.Name: baseFontColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
